FAQ.question: Why do I need a RERA Certificate before investing in a project?
FAQ.answer: It confirms that the project is officially registered, legally approved, and monitored by K-RERA, helping avoid fraud and unapproved constructions.

FAQ.question: What details are required to fetch a RERA Certificate through JaaGa?
FAQ.answer: You only need the project name to retrieve the registration details.

FAQ.question: Does a RERA certificate guarantee timely project completion?
FAQ.answer: It ensures regulatory oversight and accountability, but construction delays may still require legal follow-up with the promoter.

FAQ.question: Does the certificate confirm legal ownership of the project land?
FAQ.answer: It includes declared ownership details submitted to RERA, but full title verification requires Sale Deeds and land records.

FAQ.question: Is every property in Kerala required to be RERA-registered?
FAQ.answer: Only qualifying real-estate projects must register. Smaller or exempt projects may not appear in RERA records.

FAQ.question: Is a RERA certificate valid for home loan processing?
FAQ.answer: Yes. Banks prefer RERA-registered projects when approving home loans.

FAQ.question: Will canceled or expired RERA registrations appear when searching?
FAQ.answer: Yes, if updated in official records. Such projects may show revoked or inactive status.

FAQ.question: Does the certificate show project layout and unit details?
FAQ.answer: It may include approved plans and filings, but detailed layouts require separate sanctioned plan documents.

FAQ.question: Is resale property covered by RERA?
FAQ.answer: RERA applies to the project itself. Individual resale units may not require separate registration.
